subject: Philosophy
title: Virtue Ethics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Virtue Ethics.

hook.text: Don't ask 'what should I do?' Ask 'what kind of person should I become?' That's Aristotle's approach to ethics.

buildup.text: Virtue ethics focuses not on rules or consequences but on character. The goal is to develop virtuous habits.

discovery.text: Virtues sit between extremes. Courage lies between cowardice and recklessness. Generosity between greed and waste.

twist.text: There's no formula. Finding the right balance requires practical wisdom ‚Äî phronesis ‚Äî which only comes from experience.

climax.text: Virtue ethics is booming again today. It offers a richer, more humane alternative to rigid rule-following.

punchline.text: Be the right person and you'll do the right thing.

quiz.question: What is the 'golden mean' in Aristotle's ethics?
options: The virtuous middle point between two extremes
